New Records: Adolis Garcia won series MVP and went 10-for-28 in the series with seven runs scored, five home runs, and 15 RBI, the most RBI in any single postseason series
Key Match Events: Corey Seager launched the fourth pitch of the game 440 feet for a one-out, second-deck homer to right
Adolis Garcia went 4-for-5 with two singles and two homers, powering the Texas Rangers to an 11–4 blowout win over the Houston Astros in Game Seven of the 2023 ALCS

Garcia hit a leadoff homer to right in the third, and later in the game, he hit a two-out double by Bregman and single by Alvarez combined to cut the Rangers’ lead to 10–3 in the bottom of the seventh, and an eighth-inning home run to left-center by Garcia made the score 11–3
Pre-Game Insights: General manager Chris Young said during the clubhouse celebration, “I’m so excited and happy for our group. These guys have earned it. They deserve it, and we want to go get four more (wins)”

Manager Bruce Bochy said of the Rangers in his postgame press conference, “This team has played with so much heart and determination as any club I’ve had. They all have. But it’s just amazing how they kept getting up.”
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Bruce Bochy said that more than anything, it’s about the players and “trying to find a way to get a ring for those guys.”
Several of the players have never even been to a World Series before. One is Jankowski, now in his ninth season. When asked how he felt, he said with a grin, “Ecstatic.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rangers won their third pennant and their first since winning back-to-back in 2010 and 2011.

The Rangers await the winner of Game Seven in the National League Championship Series between the Arizona Diamondbacks and Philadelphia Phillies. No matter who wins the NL Pennant, the Rangers will have home field advantage in the World Series for the first time.
Game One will be Friday. Although the league has not officially announced a game time yet, if previous patterns hold, first pitch will be around 8 pm Eastern/7 pm Central.
